meanings.definition: To soothe or heal (a wound or injury)
meanings.sent1: She gently salved the cut on her finger with ointment.
meanings.sent2: The doctor salved the burn with a cooling gel.
meanings.sent3: The magical ointment salved the wound instantly, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words salved his wounded pride.
meanings.sent5: The soothing balm salved the pain, like a gentle touch from a friend.

meanings.definition: To relieve or alleviate (pain or distress)
meanings.sent1: The medicine salved her headache quickly.
meanings.sent2: His apology salved her hurt feelings.
meanings.sent3: A warm cup of tea always seems to salve any bad day.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can salve the soul in times of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: Music has a way of salving the heart, making everything feel better.
